meanings.definition: A stand with a slanted top used to hold a book or notes for a speaker.
meanings.sent1: The teacher placed her notes on the lectern before starting the class.
meanings.sent2: During the speech, the lecturer stood behind the lectern to address the audience.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student pretended the lectern was a spaceship during the school play.
meanings.sent4: The lectern stood like a faithful guardian, supporting the speaker's words.
meanings.sent5: The polished wood of the lectern gleamed under the bright lights of the stage.

meanings.definition: To speak or read from a lectern.
meanings.sent1: She confidently lecterned her favorite poem to the class.
meanings.sent2: The professor lecterns every Friday in the lecture hall.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he could lectern in his sleep because of his experience.
meanings.sent4: Her voice lecterned through the auditorium, capturing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The author lecterned his new book to an eager audience at the book fair.
